top_categories.workout_context: Belgian Waffle Ride Kansas’s gravel roads demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Belgian Waffle Ride Kansas isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Belgian Waffle Ride Kansas rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Belgian Waffle Ride Kansas. Make this intensity feel like home.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Belgian Waffle Ride Kansas when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Belgian Waffle Ride Kansas — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
At 80 miles, Belgian Waffle Ride Kansas punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Belgian Waffle Ride Kansas’s mixed gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Belgian Waffle Ride Kansas — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on mixed gravel.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Belgian Waffle Ride Kansas — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at Belgian Waffle Ride Kansas count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.
The varied gradients at Belgian Waffle Ride Kansas reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Belgian Waffle Ride Kansas’s 80 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Belgian Waffle Ride Kansas demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride mixed gravel at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: gravel roads. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 80 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 80 miles of mixed gravel in Lawrence, Kansas.
